greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the prime zeta modulo function at 8 for primes of the form 4k+3.
link: P. Flajolet and I. Vardi, Zeta Function Expansions of Classical Constants, Unpublished manuscript. 1996.
X. Gourdon and P. Sebah, Some Constants from Number theory.
R. J. Mathar, Table of Dirichlet L-Series and Prime Zeta Modulo Functions for Small Moduli, arXiv:1008.2547, value P(m=4, n=3, s=8), page 21.
OEIS index to entries related to the (prime) zeta function.
formula: where b(x) = (1-2^(-x))*zeta(x)/L(x) and L(x) is the Dirichlet Beta function.
mathematica: b[x_] = (1 - 2^(-x))*(Zeta[x]/DirichletBeta[x]); $MaxExtraPrecision = 320; m = 40; Join[{0, 0, 0}, RealDigits[(1/2)* NSum[MoebiusMu[2n + 1]* Log[b[(2n + 1)*8]]/(2n + 1), {n, 0, m}, AccuracyGoal -> 120, NSumTerms -> m, PrecisionGoal -> 120, WorkingPrecision -> 120] ][[1]]][[1 ;; 105]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 22 2011, updated Mar 14 2018 *)
program: (PARI) A085997_upto(N=100)={localprec(N+3); digits((PrimeZeta43(8)+1)\.1^N)[^1]} \\ see A085991 for the PrimeZeta43 function. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 25 2021
xref: Cf. A086038 (analog for primes 4k+1), A085968 (PrimeZeta(8)), A002145 (primes 4k+3).
results.author: Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)lycos.com), Jul 06 2003
